metadata.titel_preek: Jezus die een vrouw geneest: Geloof dat aanraakt

dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: SIN IS SICKNESS AND JESUS IS THE GREAT PHYSICIAN
GOD IS FATHER AND THE CHURCH IS FAMILY

cognitieve_implicaties: The solution is external to the self
ethische_implicaties: Total dependence on the 'remedy' rather than self-effort
onbedoelde_consequenties: Depersonalization of Christ (Christ as a substance rather than a person)

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher moves beyond 'Jesus heals' to 'Jesus IS the medicine', revitalizing the source domain.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher successfully bridges the Medical and Juridical domains by linking the woman's 'uncleanness' (ritual law) to her 'sickness' (physical state).

incoherentie_punten.metafoor_b: Jesus as Victim (Naked on the cross)
incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The healer suddenly becomes the one needing healing/suffering.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: A physician usually maintains health to heal; here, the physician's death is the cure.

sterktes.beschrijving: Uses the COVID-19 isolation experience to revitalize the dead metaphor of 'ritual uncleanness'.
sterktes.voorbeeld: We weten misschien nog een beetje... van Covid. Als je dan positief bevonden was, dan moest je in isolement.

risicos.beschrijving: Focusing heavily on 'healing' and 'feeling better' might obscure the gravity of sin as rebellion.
risicos.voorbeeld: Je van dood levend maken... Je helen, je genezen.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation views God primarily as a cosmic therapist.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The crowded streets of Capernaum, focusing on the tactile sensation of the crowd and the 'stiekem' (secretive) touch.

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High - creates immediate empathy for the woman's isolation.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Emphasizing the 'gratis' (free) nature of the healing compared to the expensive doctors.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Highlighting the word 'Dochter' (Daughter) to replace fear with familial intimacy.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strong connection to the Lord's Supper (Avondmaal) as a moment of public confession.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the Medical domain, which is appropriate for the text. It effectively uses the Relational domain ('Daughter') to resolve the tension created by the Juridical domain (the Law's condemnation of uncleanness).

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Describe the physical sensation of the 'kwastje' (tassel) more deeply to emphasize the 'thinness' of the barrier between the seeker and God.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Feel the rough wool of the garment between your trembling fingers.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Use the 'Organ Donor' metaphor: the physician gives his own life-force/body to save the patient.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Sickness is often blameless; sin is willful.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Balance with the 'Rebellion' metaphor more explicitly to maintain moral responsibility.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To describe the 'isolement' as a wall that Jesus breaks down.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful use of CMT to make an ancient text viscerally accessible to a modern audience through the COVID-19 analogy.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: Instead of just praising the 'beauty' of the story, CMT shows how the 'Daughter' metaphor cognitively re-categorizes the woman from 'Outcast' to 'Kin'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: While Kolb focuses on learning styles, CMT focuses on the underlying conceptual structures (Source/Target) that make the learning possible.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT reveals that the preacher uses 'Verticality' (falling down before Him) to signal a shift in power dynamics and submission.

volledige_metafoor_lijst: Glans van het leven gaat eraf
Onder de paraplu van de vrede
appendices.notities: Preacher uses 'stiekem' (secretive) to highlight the tension between the Source (Social Taboo) and Target (Desperate Faith).
